textbooks.title: Data Smart: Using Data Science to Transform Information into Insight
textbooks.author: John W. Foreman

textbooks.title: Analytics, Data Science, & Artificial Intelligence: Systems for Decision Support
textbooks.author: Ramesh Sharda, Dursun Delen, Efraim Turban

topics: Overview of Business Intelligence, Analytics, Data Science, and Artificial Intelligence
readings: Chapter 1 from Sharda, R., Delen, D., & Turban, E. (2021).

topics: Artificial Intelligence Concepts, Drivers, Major Technologies, and Business Applications
readings: Chapter 2 from Sharda, R., Delen, D., & Turban, E. (2021).

topics: Nature of Data, Statistical Modeling, and Visualization
readings: Chapter 3 from Sharda, R., Delen, D., & Turban, E. (2021).

topics: Data Mining Process, Methods, and Algorithms
readings: Chapter 4 from Sharda, R., Delen, D., & Turban, E. (2021).
Optional: Chapter 5 of The Kaggle Book.
Chapter 5 from Sharda, R., Delen, D., & Turban, E. (2021).
Chapter 6 from Sharda, R., Delen, D., & Turban, E. (2021).
Optional: Chapter 6 of The Kaggle Book.

topics: Text Mining, Sentiment Analysis, and Social Analytics
Rapid Miner and Sentiment analysis Examples
readings: Chapter 7 from Sharda, R., Delen, D., & Turban, E. (2021).
Chapter 8 from Sharda, R., Delen, D., & Turban, E. (2021).

topics: Big Data, Cloud Computing, and Location Analytics: Concepts and Tools
Rapid Miner and Big Data Analytics
readings: Chapter 9 from Sharda, R., Delen, D., & Turban, E. (2021).

topics: Rapid Miner and AI robotic applications
readings: Chapter 10 from Sharda, R., Delen, D., & Turban, E. (2021).

topics: Group Decision Making, Collaborative Systems, and AI Support
Using Tableau and Rapid Miner collaboratively
readings: Chapter 11 from Sharda, R., Delen, D., & Turban, E. (2021).

topics: Knowledge Systems: Expert Systems, Recommenders, Chatbots, Virtual Personal Assistants, and Robo Advisors
readings: Chapter 12 from Sharda, R., Delen, D., & Turban, E. (2021).

topics: The Internet of Things as a Platform for Intelligent Applications
readings: Chapters 13 and 14 from Sharda, R., Delen, D., & Turban, E. (2021).

grading.policies: Late homework submissions or final project submissions will be subject to a 20% deduction.

policies.late_work: Assignments received 1-6 days late will have 20% of the total points deducted; assignments received more than one week late will receive 0 points.
policies.academic_integrity: All Stevens graduate students promise to be fully truthful and avoid dishonesty, fraud, misrepresentation, and deceit of any type in relation to their academic work.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.course_format: This course is online with some synchronous components, like the weekly live sessions.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Basic computer and web-browsing skills, navigating Canvas, live web conferencing using Zoom.
additional_info.support_resources: Contact the Technology Resource and Assistance Center (TRAC) by calling 201-216-5500.

_metadata.course_description: This course is intended to integrate all previously taken courses in the program by presenting a set of increasingly complex business problems.
learning_outcomes: Cultivate a fundamental understanding of the descriptive, predictive, prescriptive and artificial intelligence techniques
Combine descriptive, prescriptive prescriptive and artificial intelligence methodologies using software tools
Create useful insights from structured and unstructured datasets of any size
Compare the performance of different descriptive, predictive, prescriptive and artificial intelligence techniques
Design business analytics projects focused on obtaining actionable insights from complex data
Integrate the decisions using the insights into a policy recommendation
Combine knowledge and skills to continue learning
